intent_data.goal: Change the login form frontend to use username instead of email as the login credential, since the backend already supports username login but the frontend currently requires email

requirements.description: Change login form field from email input to username input
Update field labels and placeholders to reference 'Username' instead of 'Email'
Update validation messages to reference username appropriately
Update error handling to reference username instead of email
Update forgot password functionality to handle username-based lookup (if applicable)
Switch login.html script reference from auth.js to auth-db.js (backend already supports username)
Ensure no breaking changes to authentication flow
Test that username login works end-to-end

routing_decision.reason: Simple frontend enhancement with clear requirements, single file change, backend already supports username login, minimal complexity (score 33/100)

foundation_components.baseline_intent: Change the login form frontend to use username instead of email as the login credential, since the backend already supports username login but the frontend currently requires email

requirements_summary: 8 requirements identified: 6 CRITICAL (frontend UI updates, validation, integration), 1 MEDIUM (password recovery), 1 Testing. All requirements are clear, testable, and well-defined. No blocking gaps identified.
